translated: The fifth, the tenth, the full moon, and the last day of the lunar month are the concentrations of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: de'i mtha' ni rtse mo'i cha bde ba yongs su gang ba nyid bsam gtan gyi mtha' ste de 'dzin pas na /🔽bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'chang //
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni rtse mo'i cha bde ba yongs su gang ba nyid bsam gtan gyi mtha' ste de 'dzin pas na / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'chang //
translated: The end of that is the peak section, which is the end of the concentration that is completely filled with bliss.🔽Since one holds that,

original: zhes pas so //
analyzed: zhes pas so //
translated: it is “holding the peak of the fourth concentration.”

original: da ni yan lag drug sgom zhes pa la sogs pa la 'di'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: da ni yan lag drug sgom zhes pa la sogs pa la 'di'i don 'di yin te /
translated: Now, “the meditation of the six-branched yoga” and so on. The meaning of this is as follows.

original: rgyud ni rgyud gzhan gyis rtogs bya //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyud gzhan gyis rtogs bya //
translated: The tantra is to be understood through other tantras.

original: zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definitive statement of the tathāgatas.

original: de ltar na rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa des na yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor 'di bsgom par bya ste /🔽so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog rtsol de bzhin 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa des na yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor 'di bsgom par bya ste / so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog rtsol de bzhin 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting nge 'dzin //
translated: Thus, since this is taught in other tantras, one should cultivate this yoga of six limbs.🔽The six limbs are the yoga of withdrawal,🔽the yoga of meditative concentration,🔽the yoga of vitality and exertion,🔽the yoga of retention,

original: rnal 'byor yan lag drug tu 'dod //🔽'dir so sor sdud ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams mi 'jug cing /
analyzed: rnal 'byor yan lag drug tu 'dod // 'dir so sor sdud ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams mi 'jug cing /
translated: the yoga of recollection, and the yoga of meditative concentration.

original: nang gi yul rnams la lha'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi lha'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs rnams 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi yul rnams la lha'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi lha'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs rnams 'jug pa ste /
translated: Here, withdrawal is the nonengagement of the eye consciousnesses and so on with external objects such as forms and so on, and the engagement of the divine eye consciousnesses and so on with internal objects.

original: nang du stong ba nyid la dmigs pas ma brtags par dngos po thams cad mthong ba stong pa nyid so sor snang ba phra  phab na gzhon nu mas me long la mthong ba lta bu'o zhes pa so sor sdud pa'i yan lag tu brjod de /
analyzed: nang du stong ba nyid la dmigs pas ma brtags par dngos po thams cad mthong ba stong pa nyid so sor snang ba phra  phab na gzhon nu mas me long la mthong ba lta bu'o zhes pa so sor sdud pa'i yan lag tu brjod de /
translated: The branch of individual withdrawal is said to be the subtle appearance of emptiness, the nonanalytical seeing of all things as empty by focusing on internal emptiness, like a young girl seeing her reflection in a mirror.

original: khams gsum pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan so sor mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan so sor mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The branch of meditative concentration is the concentration of the mind on the image of the Buddha of the three realms that is seen individually.🔽The branch of wisdom is the initial entry of the mind into all things that are seen as empty and existent.🔽The branch of investigation is the apprehension of the nature of the mind.

original: de nas bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni stong zhing mthong la yod pa'i chos rnams thams cad la shes rab ces bya ba dang po de rnams la sems 'jug pa dang rtog pa zhes bya ba sems kyi dngos po 'dzin pa dang spyod pa zhes bya ba dngos
analyzed: de nas bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni stong zhing mthong la yod pa'i chos rnams thams cad la shes rab ces bya ba dang po de rnams la sems 'jug pa dang rtog pa zhes bya ba sems kyi dngos po 'dzin pa dang spyod pa zhes bya ba dngos
translated: The branch of analysis is the analysis of the mind.

original: po so sor rtogs pa dang / dga' ba zhes bya ba dngos po thams cad la sems pa dang bde ba mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba dngos po thams cad la bde ba yang dag par myong ba zhes pa ste bsam gtan gyi yan lag lngar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: po so sor rtogs pa dang / dga' ba zhes bya ba dngos po thams cad la sems pa dang bde ba mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba dngos po thams cad la bde ba yang dag par myong ba zhes pa ste bsam gtan gyi yan lag lngar brjod par bya'o //
translated: (3) the branch called “bliss,” which is the experience of bliss in all things,🔽(4) the branch called “one-pointedness,” which is the mind focused on the tip of the nose,🔽and (5) the branch called “immovability,” which is the mind focused on the tip of the nose.

original: de nas srog rtsol zhes bya ba rkyang ma dang ro ma dang g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i lam 'gags pa dbu ma aa wa dh'u t'i'i lam du srog gi rlung rtag tu 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de nas srog rtsol zhes bya ba rkyang ma dang ro ma dang g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i lam 'gags pa dbu ma aa wa dh'u t'i'i lam du srog gi rlung rtag tu 'jug pa ste /
translated: Then, the branch called “life-force control” is the constant entry of the life-force wind into the central channel, the path of the lalanā, rasanā, left, and right channels.

original: @104a * // dbyung ba dang dgang ba dang bum can gyi sbyor bas bya'o zhes pa srog rtsol gyi yan lag tu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: @104a * // dbyung ba dang dgang ba dang bum can gyi sbyor bas bya'o zhes pa srog rtsol gyi yan lag tu brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is to be done by the yoga of exhalation, inhalation, and vase-breathing.

original: de nas 'dzin pa zhes bya ba srog dbang chen dang chu dang me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang / dpral bar 'jug pa phyi rol du mi 'gro bar thig le la srog 'jug par byed pa zhes pa 'dzin pa'i yan lag tu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'dzin pa zhes bya ba srog dbang chen dang chu dang me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang / dpral bar 'jug pa phyi rol du mi 'gro bar thig le la srog 'jug par byed pa zhes pa 'dzin pa'i yan lag tu brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, what is called “retention” is the life-force entering the cakras of great life-force, water, fire, and air at the navel, heart, throat, and forehead, not going outside, and entering the bindu.

original: de nas rjes su dran zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'dod pa'i lha mthong ba gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de nas rjes su dran zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'dod pa'i lha mthong ba gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Then, what is called “recollection” is seeing one’s desired deity free from the conception of a reflected image.

original: de las 'od zer du ma 'phro ba'i ngo bo 'od kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de las 'od zer du ma 'phro ba'i ngo bo 'od kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The essence of the emanation of many light rays is the maṇḍala of light.

original: de las rnam pa du ma 'phro ba'i ngo bo khams gsum pa spro bar byed pa zhes pa rjes su dran pa'i yan lag tu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de las rnam pa du ma 'phro ba'i ngo bo khams gsum pa spro bar byed pa zhes pa rjes su dran pa'i yan lag tu brjod par bya'o //
translated: The essence of the emanation of many forms is the emanation of the three realms.

original: de nas ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i lha la rjes su chags pa las gang mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob pa ste /
analyzed: de nas ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i lha la rjes su chags pa las gang mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob pa ste /
translated: Then, what is called “samādhi” is the attainment of unchanging bliss from attachment to the desired deity.

original: de las sems gcig tu byed pa sems gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag tu brjod do //
analyzed: de las sems gcig tu byed pa sems gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag tu brjod do //
translated: From that, the mind is made single-pointed, which is said to be the branch of meditative stabilization of the tathāgatas.

original: 'dir ni yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor mdor bsdus pas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor mdor bsdus pas gsungs pa ste /
translated: Here, the yoga of six branches is taught in brief.

original: rgyas par mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa'am mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas su bla ma dam pa'i gdams ngag las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi ched du rtogs par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: rgyas par mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa'am mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas su bla ma dam pa'i gdams ngag las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi ched du rtogs par bya'o zhes so //
translated: It should be understood in detail from the oral instructions of a holy guru for the purpose of the spiritual power of mahāmudrā by yogins in the Hundred Thousand Verse Tantra or the Supreme Original Buddha.

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang /
translated: Also, it is said in the Shri Paramādya:

original: so sor sdud pas rnal 'byor pa ni yul dang rnam bral sngags rnams kun gyis byin gyis rlob //
analyzed: so sor sdud pas rnal 'byor pa ni yul dang rnam bral sngags rnams kun gyis byin gyis rlob //
translated: The yogin of withdrawal is blessed by all mantras and is free from objects.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga 'thob 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bsam gtan sbyor bas dag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga 'thob 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bsam gtan sbyor bas dag pa'o //
translated: He obtains the five superknowledges, O lord of men, through the yoga of meditative stabilization.

original: srog gi rtsol bas dag pa zla ba nyi ma dang bral byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mchod //
analyzed: srog gi rtsol bas dag pa zla ba nyi ma dang bral byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mchod //
translated: By the pure prāṇa and āyāma, free from moon and sun, the bodhisattvas make offerings.

original: bdud dang nyon mongs sogs nyams stobs bcu la ni 'jug par 'gyur te 'dzin pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs sogs nyams stobs bcu la ni 'jug par 'gyur te 'dzin pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: The ten powers enter into the destruction of the power of māras, afflictions, and so on, by the power of retention.

original: rjes dran legs par dag na dri med 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rnams kyang ye shes gzigs las so //
analyzed: rjes dran legs par dag na dri med 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rnams kyang ye shes gzigs las so //
translated: If the recollections are well purified, the maṇḍalas of stainless light also arise from the vision of gnosis.

original: de nas ting nge 'dzin gyis dag na nyin zhag 'ga' zhig rnams kyis ye shes lus 'grub 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas ting nge 'dzin gyis dag na nyin zhag 'ga' zhig rnams kyis ye shes lus 'grub 'gyur //
translated: Then, if purified by samādhi, the gnosis body is accomplished in a few days.

original: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad gsungs pa /
translated: As the Bhagavān said:

original: rang gis rig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste tshig 'di'i rgyas par bstan pa /
analyzed: rang gis rig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste tshig 'di'i rgyas par bstan pa /
translated: “That which is to be known by oneself” and so on. The extensive explanation of these words

original: dpal @104b dri ma med pa'i 'od du gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal @104b dri ma med pa'i 'od du gsungs pa /
translated: is taught in the Śrī Vimalaprabhā:

original: ci ste byis pa rnams kyis 'di brjod de /
analyzed: ci ste byis pa rnams kyis 'di brjod de /
translated: “If the childish say this,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rang rig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rang rig pa yin na /
translated: if the gnosis of the tathāgatas is reflexive awareness,

original: de'i tshe chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin med par ci ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs she na /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin med par ci ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs she na /
translated: At that time, how did the Tathāgata teach that all phenomena are essenceless?

original: 'di la brjod par byas te /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par byas te /
translated: Here, we reply:

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid can shin tu gnyid log pa'i sems ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid can shin tu gnyid log pa'i sems ma yin no //
translated: Here, the Tathāgata’s wisdom, which is called “the realization that all phenomena are essenceless,” is not a mind that is utterly unconscious, which is the characteristic of the nonexistence of all things.

original: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said in the glorious Perfection of Wisdom:

original: rab 'byor sems gang zhig yod pa'i sems de ni sems ma yin te zhes pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor sems gang zhig yod pa'i sems de ni sems ma yin te zhes pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, a mind that exists is not a mind, and is called “naturally luminous.”

original: dpal mtshan yang dag par brjod par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal mtshan yang dag par brjod par yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said in the glorious Sūtra of the Teaching of Akṣayamati:

original: 'du shes kun gyi don spangs shing //
analyzed: 'du shes kun gyi don spangs shing //
translated: Abandoning the object of all discriminations,

original: rnam shes don ni 'gag par byed //🔽sems can kun yid yul can te //🔽sems can kun gyi yid rig pa //
analyzed: rnam shes don ni 'gag par byed // sems can kun yid yul can te // sems can kun gyi yid rig pa //
translated: The object of consciousness is stopped.🔽The object of the minds of all sentient beings,🔽The object of the minds of all sentient beings,

original: sems can kun gyi yid la gnas //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid la gnas //
translated: Resides in the minds of all sentient beings.

original: de rnams sems dang mnyam nyid son //
analyzed: de rnams sems dang mnyam nyid son //
translated: Those are the same as mind, having reached equality.

original: gsungs pa yang gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur na /
translated: It is said: If the wisdom of the Tathāgatas were not reflexive awareness,

original: de'i tshe sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang las de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang las de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the Tathāgatas would not teach the Dharma due to the power of sentient beings’ thoughts.

original: chos thams cad rab tu ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang yang dag par rig pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rab tu ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang yang dag par rig pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because they would not fully understand all phenomena and would not have the correct knowledge.

original: ci ste dbang po'i sgo nas rang rig pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste dbang po'i sgo nas rang rig pa yin na /
translated: If it were reflexive awareness from the perspective of the sense faculties,

original: de lta na cha med pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang thams cad la khyab mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na cha med pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang thams cad la khyab mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not be partless, all-pervading, and omnipresent.

original: sgrib pa thams cad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would be obstructed by everything.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni rang rig pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mkhyen pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni rang rig pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mkhyen pa /
translated: Therefore the wisdom of the Tathāgatas is reflexive awareness that knows the nature of all phenomena.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dbang po med pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dbang po med pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is nonconceptual and does not have sense faculties.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: thog ma med pa spros med bdag / de bzhin nyid dag dag pa'i bdag / ces so //
analyzed: thog ma med pa spros med bdag / de bzhin nyid dag dag pa'i bdag / ces so //
translated: The beginningless, unelaborate nature, the pure suchness, the pure nature.

original: rang gis 'phrog po rang byed po //🔽zhes pa la sogs ni /
analyzed: rang gis 'phrog po rang byed po // zhes pa la sogs ni /
translated: The self-same one is both the thief and the one who is robbed.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: This is stated as follows:

original: 'phrog pa po ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba'i skad cig / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis so //
analyzed: 'phrog pa po ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba'i skad cig / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste 'jig rten kun rdzob kyis so //
translated: The thief is the characteristic of the ālaya-consciousness, the moment of the transference of the mind of awakening, the coemergent joy, by means of the conventional of the world.

original: de ltar 'pho ba'i skad cig la sogs pa byed pa po dang byed pa dang / las rnams sdud pa'i byed pa po gzhan du 'dir 'gyur te /🔽gang spro ba'i byed pa po @105a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'pho ba'i skad cig la sogs pa byed pa po dang byed pa dang / las rnams sdud pa'i byed pa po gzhan du 'dir 'gyur te / gang spro ba'i byed pa po @105a * //
translated: Thus, in the moment of transference, and so on, the agent, the action, and the object of the action are included here as other.🔽The agent of the emission

original: ni byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: ni byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: is not the agent.

original: de'i phyir / mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can te yul dang rnam bral yon tan med pa rang bzhin med //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can te yul dang rnam bral yon tan med pa rang bzhin med //
translated: Therefore, the one who pervades space, the one with the vajra of space, the one free from objects, the one without qualities, the one without a nature,

original: ces pa lhan cig skyes pa'i sku //
analyzed: ces pa lhan cig skyes pa'i sku //
translated: is the coemergent body.

original: cha med kun 'gro khyab pa po //
analyzed: cha med kun 'gro khyab pa po //
translated: The one without parts, the one who pervades all,

original: phra zhing zag med sa bon dang // rdzas kun las ni rnam par grol //
analyzed: phra zhing zag med sa bon dang // rdzas kun las ni rnam par grol //
translated: the subtle one, the one without impurity, the one without seeds, the one liberated from all substances,🔽the one who abides in the path of space,

original: nam mkha'i lam la shin tu gnas //
analyzed: nam mkha'i lam la shin tu gnas //
translated: the one who is not an object of the mind,🔽the one who is not an object of the intellect,🔽the one who is not an object of the mind,🔽the one who is not an object of the mental consciousness,🔽the one who is not an object of the five sense consciousnesses,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three times,🔽the one who is not an object of the three existences,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one who is not an object of the three realms,🔽the one

original: zhes so // de'i phyir spro ba dang sdud pa'i byed pa po mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can yang med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir spro ba dang sdud pa'i byed pa po mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can yang med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, there is no creator of the act of expansion and contraction, which is characterized by nirvana.🔽This is the meaning.

original: de ltar byed pa po zad pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po zad pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the certainty of the exhaustion of the creator.

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas su gsungs pa yang //
translated: It is also stated in the Shri Paramdiitya:

original: de phyir byed po 'ga' yang srog chags rnams kyi bde dang sdug bsngal mi sbyin mi 'phrog ste /
analyzed: de phyir byed po 'ga' yang srog chags rnams kyi bde dang sdug bsngal mi sbyin mi 'phrog ste /
translated: Therefore, no creator gives or takes away the happiness and suffering of living beings.

original: 'khor ba rnam pa gsum po gang byas sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu rab tu sbyin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba rnam pa gsum po gang byas sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu rab tu sbyin par 'gyur //
translated: Whatever was previously created in the three realms will give its fruit.

original: skye dang sdud pa'i byed pa po 'di ster zhing des 'phrog rmongs pa rnams kyi blo gros te //
analyzed: skye dang sdud pa'i byed pa po 'di ster zhing des 'phrog rmongs pa rnams kyi blo gros te //
translated: This is the giver and taker of the act of expansion and contraction, the intelligence of the deluded.

original: lus la dpag med dge ba 'phrog byed bug pa rang gi dbang po rnams kyis mthong ma yin //
analyzed: lus la dpag med dge ba 'phrog byed bug pa rang gi dbang po rnams kyis mthong ma yin //
translated: The body's immeasurable virtue is not seen to be taken away by the holes of the senses.

original: rang nyid byed pa po zhes pa la sogs pa ste spro ba ni srid pa spro ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid byed pa po zhes pa la sogs pa ste spro ba ni srid pa spro ba'o //
translated: The line one's own creator and so on. Expansion is the expansion of existence.

original: 'phrog po zhes pa sdud pa po'o //
analyzed: 'phrog po zhes pa sdud pa po'o //
translated: The taker is the one who contracts.

original: rgyal po zhes pa spro ba med cing 'phrog pa med pa spro ba dang sdud pa las rnam par grol ba rang bzhin gyis gnas pa /
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa spro ba med cing 'phrog pa med pa spro ba dang sdud pa las rnam par grol ba rang bzhin gyis gnas pa /
translated: The king is the one who is without expansion and without contraction, who is free from expansion and contraction, who abides by nature,

original: zla ba lta bur rnam par gsal lo zhes pas rgyal po'o //
analyzed: zla ba lta bur rnam par gsal lo zhes pas rgyal po'o //
translated: and who is clear like the moon.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal //
translated: The lord of Dharma, the king of Dharma,

original: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po //
analyzed: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po //
translated: The one who shows the good path.

original: zhes so // 'di tsam gyis kyang sems kho na mya ngan las 'das pa dang sems kho na 'khor ba'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes so // 'di tsam gyis kyang sems kho na mya ngan las 'das pa dang sems kho na 'khor ba'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By this much it is taught that only mind is nirvāṇa and only mind is saṃsāra.

original: dpal rdo rje rtse mor gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje rtse mor gsungs pa yang /
translated: Also, it is said in the glorious Vajraśekhara:

original: 'khor ba'i don ni ci zhig lags //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i don ni ci zhig lags //
translated: What is the meaning of saṃsāra?

original: ji ltar byis pa rnams 'byung zhing //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rnams 'byung zhing //
translated: How do the childish arise?

original: yang dang yang du 'khor byed de //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'khor byed de //
translated: Again and again they cycle,🔽and that is the powerful self of saṃsāra,

original: de yang 'khor ba'i drag pa'i bdag / nga nyid yin te rang nyid gtso //
analyzed: de yang 'khor ba'i drag pa'i bdag / nga nyid yin te rang nyid gtso //
translated: I myself am the chief.

original: mya ngan 'das las 'das pa'ang ci //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das las 'das pa'ang ci //
translated: What is beyond nirvāṇa?🔽It is said:

original: zhes brjod // dbye bya de bzhin stong nyid gang //
analyzed: zhes brjod // dbye bya de bzhin stong nyid gang //
translated: That which is to be divided, and likewise emptiness,

original: de yis rang bzhin rnam par spangs //
analyzed: de yis rang bzhin rnam par spangs //
translated: By that, intrinsic nature is abandoned.

original: dngos po'i ngo bos mtshan nyid dang // mtshan ma yang ni rnam par spangs //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bos mtshan nyid dang // mtshan ma yang ni rnam par spangs //
translated: The nature of things is devoid of characteristics and signs.

original: ngag sgra yang na gzung ba dang // rnam rtog rdul phran yod min te //
analyzed: ngag sgra yang na gzung ba dang // rnam rtog rdul phran yod min te //
translated: Speech, sound, and the object of apprehension are not existent, nor are the subtle particles of conceptualization.

original: de phyir mya ngan 'das pa'i sgras //
analyzed: de phyir mya ngan 'das pa'i sgras //
translated: Therefore, by the word “nirvāṇa,”

original: nga nyid kho na skye dgu'i bdag / ces so //
analyzed: nga nyid kho na skye dgu'i bdag / ces so //
translated: I alone am the lord of beings.

original: dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud las rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po bsdus pa'i @105b dka' 'grel du bdag med ma'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud las rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po bsdus pa'i @105b dka' 'grel du bdag med ma'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o /
translated: In the commentary on the condensed essence of the vajra words from the glorious Hevajra Tantra, this is the eighth chapter on Nairātmya.

original: // / da ni de las la gzhan zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par dag pa de kho na nyid dang dbye bas te /
analyzed: // / da ni de las la gzhan zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par dag pa de kho na nyid dang dbye bas te /
translated: Now, beginning with “other than that,” it is divided into the purity of reality.

original: thog mar de kho na nyid kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /🔽dpal rdo rje rtse mor gsungs pa /
analyzed: thog mar de kho na nyid kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa / dpal rdo rje rtse mor gsungs pa /
translated: First, the purity of reality is stated:🔽It is said in the glorious Vajraśekhara:

original: dpal rdo rje rtse mor gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje rtse mor gsungs pa /
translated: It is said in the glorious Vajraśekhara:

original: rnam par dag pa ci zhig brjod //🔽yod min med pa'ang ma yin la //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ci zhig brjod // yod min med pa'ang ma yin la //
translated: What is called “purity”?🔽It is not existent, nor is it nonexistent.

original: dngos po med cing dngos med min //
analyzed: dngos po med cing dngos med min //
translated: It is not a thing, nor is it a non-thing.

original: smra po med cing smra bya'ang min //
analyzed: smra po med cing smra bya'ang min //
translated: It is not a speaker, nor is it what is spoken.

original: rnam dag mya ngan 'das pa nyid //
analyzed: rnam dag mya ngan 'das pa nyid //
translated: It is pure, and is nirvana itself.

original: ces so // dngos po thams cad kyi zhes pa la sogs pa phyi rol dang nang gi rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po rnams mnyam pa nyid /
analyzed: ces so // dngos po thams cad kyi zhes pa la sogs pa phyi rol dang nang gi rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po rnams mnyam pa nyid /
translated: The equality of external and internal things, such as the entities of conceptualization, is pure suchness.

original: rnam dag de bzhin nyid de de lta kho nar rtag tu gnas pa ni de bzhin nyid de rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa nyid kyis rtag tu rnam par dag pa nam mkha' bzhin du 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin du bshad la /
analyzed: rnam dag de bzhin nyid de de lta kho nar rtag tu gnas pa ni de bzhin nyid de rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa nyid kyis rtag tu rnam par dag pa nam mkha' bzhin du 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin du bshad la /
translated: It is suchness because it always abides just as it is. It is pure because it is always stainless by nature. It is explained to be uncompounded by nature, like space.

original: de'i ngo bo sa  de bzhin nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo sa  de bzhin nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Its essence is suchness. It should be cultivated.

original: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin nyid kyi le'ur gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin nyid kyi le'ur gsungs pa /
translated: It is stated in the chapter on suchness of the glorious Perfection of Wisdom:

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'gyur ba med pa rnam par 'gyur ba med pa rtog pa med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa 'ga' zhig tu yang gzhom du med pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'gyur ba med pa rnam par 'gyur ba med pa rtog pa med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa 'ga' zhig tu yang gzhom du med pa ste /
translated: “Just as the suchness of the Tathagata is unchanging, without transformation, non-conceptual, without conceptualization, and cannot be destroyed in any way,

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ni 'gyur ba med pa rnam par 'gyur ba med pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ni 'gyur ba med pa rnam par 'gyur ba med pa /
translated: Likewise, the suchness of all phenomena is unchanging, without transformation,

original: rtog pa med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa 'ga' zhig tu yang gzhom du med pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa 'ga' zhig tu yang gzhom du med pa'o //
translated: without thought, without discursive thought, and cannot be destroyed in any way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang gang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid na gcig pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang gang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid na gcig pa kho na ste /
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata and the suchness of all phenomena are exactly the same.

original: de bzhin nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa'o zhes so //
translated: This suchness is nondual and cannot be made dual.

original: de bzhin du dpal mtshan yang dag par brjod par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal mtshan yang dag par brjod par yang gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, the Śrī-Māyājāla says:

original: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid //
translated: The true absence of self is suchness,

original: yang dag mtha' ste 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: yang dag mtha' ste 'gyur ba med //
translated: the ultimate reality, and is unchanging.

original: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
analyzed: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
translated: The supreme bull who proclaims emptiness,

original: zab cing rgya che'i sgra sgrogs pa //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che'i sgra sgrogs pa //
translated: proclaims the sound of the profound and vast.

original: zhes so // bye brag med par rtogs par byas nas //
analyzed: zhes so // bye brag med par rtogs par byas nas //
translated: Having realized this without distinction,

original: phyi nas zhes pa la sogs pas re re yis te /
analyzed: phyi nas zhes pa la sogs pas re re yis te /
translated: then, as it is said, “one by one,”

original: phung po la sogs pa'i dbye bas lha rnams kyi rnam par dag pa phyi nas rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i dbye bas lha rnams kyi rnam par dag pa phyi nas rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The purities of the deities should be understood later by way of the divisions of the aggregates and so forth.

original: gzugs phung rdo rje ma ru 'gyur //
analyzed: gzugs phung rdo rje ma ru 'gyur //
translated: The form aggregate is Vajrā

original: zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: and so forth.

original: 'o na dbang po la sogs pa rnams ci'i phyir rnam par dag par brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na dbang po la sogs pa rnams ci'i phyir rnam par dag par brjod ce na /
translated: Well then, why are the sense faculties and so forth said to be pure?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / nyon mongs mi shes bsgribs pa zhes pa ste /🔽mi shes pa ni ma rig pa nga dang nga @106a * //
analyzed: gsungs pa / nyon mongs mi shes bsgribs pa zhes pa ste / mi shes pa ni ma rig pa nga dang nga @106a * //
translated: Obscured by the afflictions and ignorance.

original: yi'o snyam du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yi'o snyam du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is the ignorance of “I” and “mine.”

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i las kyi rgyu sems kyi bye brag rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i las kyi rgyu sems kyi bye brag rnams so //
translated: The afflictions are the various states of mind that are the causes of desirable and undesirable actions.

original: de rnams kyis sgribs pa ni g-yogs pa ste de sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis sgribs pa ni g-yogs pa ste de sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Obscured by those means covered by them, and that is to be purified.

original: dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od du gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od du gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said in the Śrī Vimalaprabhā:

original: stong pa las ni dngos po'i tshogs /
analyzed: stong pa las ni dngos po'i tshogs /
translated: From emptiness, the collection of things

original: brtags pa'i gzugs ni rnam spangs gang //
analyzed: brtags pa'i gzugs ni rnam spangs gang //
translated: is the form that is imagined, abandoned.

original: snang ba mthong ste me long la //
analyzed: snang ba mthong ste me long la //
translated: Seeing appearances is like

original: pra phab gzhon nu ma yis bzhin //
analyzed: pra phab gzhon nu ma yis bzhin //
translated: a young girl performing a mirror divination.

original: zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pas gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dag pa me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pas gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dag pa me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the purification of the aggregate of form, the mirror-like primordial wisdom.

original: dngos po thams cad mnyam gyur nas //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mnyam gyur nas //
translated: All things become the same,

original: dngos po gcig po 'gyur med gnas //
analyzed: dngos po gcig po 'gyur med gnas //
translated: and the one thing abides unchanging.

original: 'gyur med ye shes las byung ba //
analyzed: 'gyur med ye shes las byung ba //
translated: From the unchanging primordial wisdom

original: chad pa ma yin rtag pa min //
analyzed: chad pa ma yin rtag pa min //
translated: there is neither annihilation nor permanence.

original: zhes pa tshor ba'i phung po rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa tshor ba'i phung po rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: This is the purification of the aggregate of feeling, the primordial wisdom of equanimity.

original: ming gi bdag nyid yi ge kun //
analyzed: ming gi bdag nyid yi ge kun //
translated: All the letters that are the nature of names

original: aa yig rigs las yang dag byung //
analyzed: aa yig rigs las yang dag byung //
translated: are perfectly produced from the family of the letter A.

original: 'gyur med chen po'i go 'phang thob //
analyzed: 'gyur med chen po'i go 'phang thob //
translated: They attain the state of great immutability,

original: ming med ming dang ldan pa'ang med //
analyzed: ming med ming dang ldan pa'ang med //
translated: without name, and also not possessing a name.

original: ces pa 'du shes kyi phung po rnam par dag pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ces pa 'du shes kyi phung po rnam par dag pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the purification of the aggregate of perception, the primordial wisdom of individual discernment.

original: skyes pa med pa'i chos rnams ni //
analyzed: skyes pa med pa'i chos rnams ni //
translated: The unborn phenomena

original: 'du byed bral ba rnams la yang //
analyzed: 'du byed bral ba rnams la yang //
translated: are free from the compounded.

original: sangs rgyas nyid med byang chub med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid med byang chub med //
translated: There is no buddhahood, no enlightenment,

original: sems can med cing srog nyid med //
analyzed: sems can med cing srog nyid med //
translated: no sentient beings, and no life force.

original: ces pa 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par dag pa bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ces pa 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par dag pa bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the wisdom of accomplishing activities, the pure aggregate of compositional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid 'das //
translated: The reality of consciousness is past.

original: ye shes rnam dag gos pa med //
analyzed: ye shes rnam dag gos pa med //
translated: Wisdom is pure, unstained.

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal chos rnams ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal chos rnams ni //
translated: The luminous nature of phenomena

original: chos kyi dbyings su son zhing rtogs //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su son zhing rtogs //
translated: is reached and realized as the basic space of phenomena.

original: zhes pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so zhes so //
translated: This is the wisdom of the basic space of phenomena, the pure aggregate of consciousness.

original: slar yang de nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang de nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: Again, the same source states:

original: rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ye shes ni 'pho ba'i bde ba dang / rtog pa'i sgrib pa zad pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ye shes ni 'pho ba'i bde ba dang / rtog pa'i sgrib pa zad pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The wisdom of emptiness in all its aspects is the exhaustion of the obscurations related to the bliss of movement and concepts.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is the purity of the aggregates, elements, sense fields, and so forth.

original: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang rnam par dag pa'i le'ur gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang rnam par dag pa'i le'ur gsungs pa /
translated: The glorious Perfection of Wisdom too, in the chapter on purity, states:

original: rab 'byor gang gzugs rnam par dag pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gzugs rnam par dag pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa /
translated: Subhūti, the purity of form is the purity of results.

original: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: That which is the purity of the result is the purity of form.

original: rab 'byor de lta na gzugs rnam par dag pa dang / 'bras bu rnam par dag pa 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de lta na gzugs rnam par dag pa dang / 'bras bu rnam par dag pa 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do //
translated: Subhūti, in this way the purity of form and the purity of the result are not two, nor are they divided, nor are they cut apart, nor are they otherwise.

original: @106b rab 'byor de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: @106b rab 'byor de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams te /
translated: Subhūti, it is the same with the purity of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: rab 'byor rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa /
translated: Subhūti, that which is the purity of consciousness is the purity of the result.

original: gang 'bras bu rnam par dag pa de ni rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang 'bras bu rnam par dag pa de ni rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes so //
translated: That which is the purity of the result is the purity of consciousness.

original: 'jig rten ji bzhin de sangs rgyas //
analyzed: 'jig rten ji bzhin de sangs rgyas //
translated: The Buddha is just like the world.

original: ji ltar chos ni rnyog med pa //
analyzed: ji ltar chos ni rnyog med pa //
translated: Just as the Dharma is free of defilements,

original: de ltar sems can khams rnams bshad //
analyzed: de ltar sems can khams rnams bshad //
translated: So too are the realms of sentient beings explained.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du dri ma med //🔽dam min kun rtog rnam rtog gis //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du dri ma med // dam min kun rtog rnam rtog gis //
translated: Like space, they are stainless.

original: sems kyi rin chen dri mar byas //
analyzed: sems kyi rin chen dri mar byas //
translated: The precious mind is defiled by the conceptual thoughts of the non-sacred.

original: sems dag na ni dag par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems dag na ni dag par 'gyur //
translated: When the mind is purified, it becomes pure.

original: nam mkha' 'jig med ji bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'jig med ji bzhin no //
translated: Just like the sky, which is indestructible.

original: dpal dgongs pa lung du ston pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal dgongs pa lung du ston pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa yang /
translated: The glorious Tantra of the Dialogue with Subāhu says:

original: lcags kyi gong bu chur dor pa //
analyzed: lcags kyi gong bu chur dor pa //
translated: When a lump of iron is thrown into water,

original: 'byings  pa 'ba' zhig kho na'o //🔽de nyid snod du byas pas gzhan //
analyzed: 'byings  pa 'ba' zhig kho na'o // de nyid snod du byas pas gzhan //
translated: it sinks to the very bottom.🔽When it is made into a vessel, it floats

original: sgrol 'jug rang nyid sgrol bar byed //
analyzed: sgrol 'jug rang nyid sgrol bar byed //
translated: and can carry others while it itself is carried.

original: de bzhin snod du byas pa'i sems //
analyzed: de bzhin snod du byas pa'i sems //
translated: In the same way, a mind that has become a vessel

original: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin las //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin las //
translated: through the nature of wisdom and method

original: rang nyid grol zhing gzhan grol byed //
analyzed: rang nyid grol zhing gzhan grol byed //
translated: liberates itself and liberates others.

original: mchog tu dga' bas rol par byed //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' bas rol par byed //
translated: It plays with supreme ecstasy.🔽Form, sound, and likewise smell,

original: ces so // gzugs sgra de bzhin dri dang ni //🔽ro dang reg bya rang bzhin las //
analyzed: ces so // gzugs sgra de bzhin dri dang ni // ro dang reg bya rang bzhin las //
translated: taste, and touch

original: chos kyi dbyings ni mchog tu zhi //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni mchog tu zhi //
translated: are the supreme peace of the realm of phenomena.

original: sems ni rin chen zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems ni rin chen zhes bshad do //
translated: The mind is explained to be a jewel.

original: yid bzhin nor bu rin chen che //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu rin chen che //
translated: The wish-fulfilling jewel is a great jewel

original: 'dod pa'i don gyi 'bras bu ster //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don gyi 'bras bu ster //
translated: that grants the fruit of whatever is wished for.

original: de bzhin sems ni yongs dag pa //
analyzed: de bzhin sems ni yongs dag pa //
translated: In the same way, the completely pure mind

original: sangs rgyas byang chub 'bras bu ster //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub 'bras bu ster //
translated: grants the fruit of buddhahood and awakening.

original: khrag dang khu ba las byung lus //
analyzed: khrag dang khu ba las byung lus //
translated: The body, which arises from blood and semen,

original: zhes bshad rdo rje dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: zhes bshad rdo rje dbang phyug ste //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: sen mo ba spu de bzhin du //
analyzed: sen mo ba spu de bzhin du //
translated: The nails and the body hair are the same.

original: khams kyi khu bar spyan ras gzigs //
analyzed: khams kyi khu bar spyan ras gzigs //
translated: Avalokiteśvara is in the semen of the elements.

original: khrag dang pags pa gzi brjid che //
analyzed: khrag dang pags pa gzi brjid che //
translated: Blood and skin are Mahātejas.

original: tshil dang rkang la rdo rje 'dzin //🔽phyi sar rnam par snang mdzad mgon //
analyzed: tshil dang rkang la rdo rje 'dzin // phyi sar rnam par snang mdzad mgon //
translated: Fat and marrow are Vajradhara.🔽The feces are the protector Vairocana.

original: rtsa yi rdzas la bdud rgyal po //
analyzed: rtsa yi rdzas la bdud rgyal po //
translated: The substance of the channels is the king of demons.

original: lnga po 'di rnams sangs rgyas lnga //
analyzed: lnga po 'di rnams sangs rgyas lnga //
translated: These five are the five buddhas.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gros gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gros gsungs pa yin //
translated: This is the teaching of Vajraḍāka.

original: sa yi khams ni rnam dag las //
analyzed: sa yi khams ni rnam dag las //
translated: From the pure earth element

original: 'khor los mdzes pa spyan ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor los mdzes pa spyan ma'o //
translated: is the beautiful Cakrasaṃvara, Lochanā.

original: shin tu dang bar rdo rje'i yum //
analyzed: shin tu dang bar rdo rje'i yum //
translated: The very clear one is Vajrī.

original: me la padma'i bu mo'o //
analyzed: me la padma'i bu mo'o //
translated: The fire is Padminī.

original: sgrol ma rlung ni rnam dag pas //🔽rdo rje'i btsun mo bzhi po rnams //
analyzed: sgrol ma rlung ni rnam dag pas // rdo rje'i btsun mo bzhi po rnams //
translated: Tārā is the pure wind.🔽These four vajra queens

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i mtshan can gyi //🔽gur gyis 'di rnams gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i mtshan can gyi // gur gyis 'di rnams gsungs pa yin //
translated: are taught by the one named Vajraḍāka.

original: chags pas 'jig rten bskyed bya ste //
analyzed: chags pas 'jig rten bskyed bya ste //
translated: The world is generated by passion;

original: 'dod chags zad las zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags zad las zad par 'gyur //
translated: from the exhaustion of passion, there is exhaustion.

original: rdo rje'i chags pa yongs shes las //
analyzed: rdo rje'i chags pa yongs shes las //
translated: From the complete knowledge of vajra passion,

original: yid ni rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur //
analyzed: yid ni rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur //
translated: The mind becomes Vajrasattva.

original: zhes so // gsungs pa yang /🔽gang phyir rgyud gang kho na las //
analyzed: zhes so // gsungs pa yang / gang phyir rgyud gang kho na las //
translated: It is also said:

original: las kyi bag chags @107a * //
analyzed: las kyi bag chags @107a * //
translated: Because the latent tendencies of karma

original: bsgos gyur pa //
analyzed: bsgos gyur pa //
translated: are infused in a continuum,

original: de kho na las 'bras bu 'brel //
analyzed: de kho na las 'bras bu 'brel //
translated: the result is connected to that very [continuum],

original: ral ba las ni mar nyid bzhin //
analyzed: ral ba las ni mar nyid bzhin //
translated: just like butter from milk.

original: zhes so // gal te dngos po ma dag yod min yang //
analyzed: zhes so // gal te dngos po ma dag yod min yang //
translated: Even if impure things do not exist,

original: de lta na yang rgyal ba rnams kyis sbyong //🔽kun rdzob bden pa brten pa'i 'khor lo yi //
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyal ba rnams kyis sbyong // kun rdzob bden pa brten pa'i 'khor lo yi //
translated: the victors purify them.🔽It is merely the meditation on the essence of reality

original: chos nyid ngo bo rnam par bsgoms pa tsam //
analyzed: chos nyid ngo bo rnam par bsgoms pa tsam //
translated: of the wheel of dependent origination, the relative truth.

original: chos las dngos po yang dag rnam par dben //
analyzed: chos las dngos po yang dag rnam par dben //
translated: Things are completely devoid of reality,

original: gang zag thams cad rnam spangs 'jig rten te //
analyzed: gang zag thams cad rnam spangs 'jig rten te //
translated: and the world is devoid of all persons.

original: 'jig rten 'gro ba bsam par nus ma yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'gro ba bsam par nus ma yin //
translated: The world of beings cannot be conceived.

original: chos nyid ngo bor thams cad rnam par dag / gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: chos nyid ngo bor thams cad rnam par dag / gsungs pa yang //
translated: Everything is pure in the essence of reality.🔽It is also said:

original: rnam par dag pa bdag med chos //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa bdag med chos //
translated: The pure reality is selfless,

original: yang dag ye shes zla 'od bzang //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes zla 'od bzang //
translated: with the excellent moonlight of perfect wisdom.

original: zhes so // gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: zhes so // gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: dril sogs pa'i yul de rnams gzhan yin la /
analyzed: dril sogs pa'i yul de rnams gzhan yin la /
translated: Those objects such as bells are different,

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i yul can de rnams gzhan yin zhing /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i yul can de rnams gzhan yin zhing /
translated: The subjects of those, such as the ears, are different.

original: ngag dang lag pa la sogs pa'i rnams gzhan dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba la sogs pa rnams gzhan te /
analyzed: ngag dang lag pa la sogs pa'i rnams gzhan dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba la sogs pa rnams gzhan te /
translated: The speech, hands, and so on are different, and the actions of the organs of action are different.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: thams cad du ni phyag zhabs sogs //
analyzed: thams cad du ni phyag zhabs sogs //
translated: the hands, feet, and so on are everywhere.

original: kun du spyan dang dbu dang zhal //🔽kun du thos ldan 'jig rten du //
analyzed: kun du spyan dang dbu dang zhal // kun du thos ldan 'jig rten du //
translated: Eyes, heads, and faces are everywhere.

original: thams cad khyab par byas te bzhugs //
analyzed: thams cad khyab par byas te bzhugs //
translated: The ears are everywhere, and the world is filled with them.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' 'o zhes so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' 'o zhes so //
translated: It is the abode of Vajrasattva.🔽Thus,

original: de ltar / bdag rig gzhan rig thams cad pa //
analyzed: de ltar / bdag rig gzhan rig thams cad pa //
translated: knowing the self and knowing everything,🔽the supreme person who benefits all,

original: kun la phan pa'i gang zag mchog /'jig rten dpe las 'das pa ste //
analyzed: kun la phan pa'i gang zag mchog /'jig rten dpe las 'das pa ste //
translated: is beyond the world and beyond example.

original: shes dang shes bya'i bdag po mchog / ces so //
analyzed: shes dang shes bya'i bdag po mchog / ces so //
translated: The supreme lord of knowledge and the object of knowledge.

original: phyag bcu drug rnam par dag pas stong pa nyid bcu drug rnams so zhes pa 'dir nges pa'i don ni dpal dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyag bcu drug rnam par dag pas stong pa nyid bcu drug rnams so zhes pa 'dir nges pa'i don ni dpal dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od du yang gsungs pa /
translated: The purity of the sixteen hands is the sixteen emptinesses.

original: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa dang 'dir stong pa nyid ni phung po lnga stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa dang 'dir stong pa nyid ni phung po lnga stong pa nyid de /
translated: Here, emptiness is the emptiness of the five aggregates.

original: nag po'i tshes gcig la sogs pa tshes lnga rnams nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: nag po'i tshes gcig la sogs pa tshes lnga rnams nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: The five days beginning with the first of the dark phase are the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, the emptiness of the outer and inner, the emptiness of emptiness, and the emptiness of the great.

original: khams lnga stong pa nyid ni drug pa la sogs pa'i tshes lnga rnams te /
analyzed: khams lnga stong pa nyid ni drug pa la sogs pa'i tshes lnga rnams te /
translated: The emptiness of the five elements is the five days beginning with the sixth.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid rnams so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid rnams so zhes pa'o //
translated: They are the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of that which transcends extremes, and the emptiness of that which is beginningless and endless.

original: dbang po lnga stong pa nyid ni bcu gcig pa la sogs pa tshes lnga rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po lnga stong pa nyid ni bcu gcig pa la sogs pa tshes lnga rnams te /
translated: The emptiness of the five sense organs is the five days beginning with the eleventh.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin @107b stong pa nyid dang // rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin @107b stong pa nyid dang // rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of non-rejection, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-entities, the emptiness of all phenomena, and the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: gnam stong gi mthar thug pa nyid bco lnga rnams so //
analyzed: gnam stong gi mthar thug pa nyid bco lnga rnams so //
translated: The end of the dark fortnight is the fifteenth.

original: dkar po'i tshes gcig 'jug pa'i dus su de dag gi dbus su stong pa nyid bcu drug pa dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i tshes gcig 'jug pa'i dus su de dag gi dbus su stong pa nyid bcu drug pa dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad pa'o //
translated: At the time of the entry of the first day of the bright fortnight, in the middle of those, the sixteenth emptiness, the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-entities, is all-encompassing.

original: de bzhin du snying rje rnam pa gsum ste 'di dag gcig pa nyid stong pa nyid bcu drug dang snying rje bcu drug gi bdag nyid can gyi brjod par bya ba phyag bcu drug pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje rnam pa gsum ste 'di dag gcig pa nyid stong pa nyid bcu drug dang snying rje bcu drug gi bdag nyid can gyi brjod par bya ba phyag bcu drug pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
translated: Likewise, there are three types of compassion. The identity of these sixteen emptinesses and sixteen compassions is the sixteen-fold object of expression, the purity of the sixteen-handed ones. This is the definitive meaning.

original: zhabs bzhi zhes pa bdud bzhi rnam par dag pa las te /
analyzed: zhabs bzhi zhes pa bdud bzhi rnam par dag pa las te /
translated: The four feet are from the purity of the four māras.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is said:

original: sems can rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang sems dang ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi rnam pa ni bdud bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang sems dang ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi rnam pa ni bdud bzhi rnams te /
translated: The four demons are the forms of the bodies, speech, minds, and ignorance-habit energies of sentient beings.

original: de rnams la lus kyi sgrib pa ni phung po'i bdud do //
analyzed: de rnams la lus kyi sgrib pa ni phung po'i bdud do //
translated: The body obscurations are the demon of the aggregates.

original: ngag gi sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud do //
analyzed: ngag gi sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud do //
translated: The speech obscurations are the demon of afflictions.

original: sems kyi sgrib pa ni 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
analyzed: sems kyi sgrib pa ni 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
translated: The mind obscurations are the demon of death.

original: phyi rol du ma rig pa 'jug pa ni lha'i bu'i bdud ste zhes so //
analyzed: phyi rol du ma rig pa 'jug pa ni lha'i bu'i bdud ste zhes so //
translated: The external engagement of ignorance is the demon of the sons of the gods.

original: dpal mtshan yang dag par brjod par gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: dpal mtshan yang dag par brjod par gsungs pa yang /
translated: The Sri-nama-samgiti says:

original: dpa' bo bdud dgra bdud las rgyal //
analyzed: dpa' bo bdud dgra bdud las rgyal //
translated: The hero, the enemy of demons, is victorious over demons.

original: bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa mthar byed pa //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa mthar byed pa //
translated: He is the one who puts an end to the fear of the four demons.

original: bdud kyi dpung kun pham par byed //
analyzed: bdud kyi dpung kun pham par byed //
translated: He is the one who defeats all the armies of demons.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten 'dren //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten 'dren //
translated: The perfect Buddha is the guide of the world.

original: zhes so // zhal rnams rnam par thar pa brgyad //
analyzed: zhes so // zhal rnams rnam par thar pa brgyad //
translated: The faces are the eight liberations.

original: ces pa 'di'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: ces pa 'di'i don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: dpal mngon par brjod pa phyi mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal mngon par brjod pa phyi mar gsungs pa /
translated: The Sri-nama-samgiti-uttama says:

original: gzugs can gzugs la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is the form having form looking.

original: nang gzugs med pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams lta ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams lta ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the vision of external forms by one who is internally formless.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the liberation of the beautiful, which is the state of one who has actualized and perfected the body.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The sphere of infinite space is the fourth.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The sphere of infinite consciousness is the fifth.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sphere of nothingness is the sixth.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is the seventh.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni brgyad pa ste /
translated: The meditative absorption of cessation is the eighth.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pas zhal rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pas zhal rnams so //
translated: The faces are the eight liberations.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi dag pa'i spyan //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi dag pa'i spyan //
translated: The eyes are the purities of the three vajras.

original: zhes pa la gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: zhes pa la gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: sprul pa yis ni rtag tu skye //
analyzed: sprul pa yis ni rtag tu skye //
translated: Always born through emanation,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i byed rgyu gnas //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i byed rgyu gnas //
translated: the cause of the enjoyment body,

original: chos kyi sku yi rang bzhin gyis //🔽thim @108a * //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yi rang bzhin gyis // thim @108a * //
translated: by the nature of the dharmakāya,

original: par 'gyur te the tshom med //
analyzed: par 'gyur te the tshom med //
translated: dissolves without doubt.

original: de bzhin du 'di nyid du yang gsungs pa //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di nyid du yang gsungs pa //
translated: Likewise, it is stated in this very [Hevajra Tantra]:

original: gang dang gang gis 'jig rten 'ching 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis 'jig rten 'ching 'gyur ba //
translated: Whatever and however the world is bound,

original: de dang des ni 'ching ba las grol te //
analyzed: de dang des ni 'ching ba las grol te //
translated: By that and by that it is freed from bondage.

original: 'jig rten rmongs pa de nyid ma rtogs pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten rmongs pa de nyid ma rtogs pa //
translated: The world is deluded, not realizing reality,

original: de nyid rnams spangs dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid rnams spangs dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: And by abandoning reality, attainments are not found.

original: de phyir dri med sgra med gzugs nyid med //
analyzed: de phyir dri med sgra med gzugs nyid med //
translated: Therefore, there is no stainless, no sound, no form itself,🔽No taste, and the mind is completely pure.🔽No touch, no phenomena, all are completely pure.

original: ro yang med de sems ni rnam par dag / reg med chos med thams cad rnam par dag / rang bzhin dag pa'i 'gro la 'gro bar shes /
analyzed: ro yang med de sems ni rnam par dag / reg med chos med thams cad rnam par dag / rang bzhin dag pa'i 'gro la 'gro bar shes /
translated: Knowing the world to be the pure nature of beings,

original: zhes pa dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud du rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel du rnam par dag pa'i le'u ste dgu pa'o /
analyzed: zhes pa dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud du rdo rje'i tshig gi snying po bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel du rnam par dag pa'i le'u ste dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the ninth chapter, the chapter on complete purity, in the commentary on the essence of the vajra words of the glorious Hevajra Tantra.

original: // / da ni dkyil 'khor med par dbang bskur sbyin par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: // / da ni dkyil 'khor med par dbang bskur sbyin par mi bya zhing /
translated: Now, empowerment should not be bestowed without a mandala,

original: dbang bskur ba med pa la de kho na nyid gsal bar bya ba ma yin no zhes pas /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba med pa la de kho na nyid gsal bar bya ba ma yin no zhes pas /
translated: and without empowerment, reality should not be revealed.

original: dkyil 'khor sngon du 'gro ba'i dbang bskur ba'i le'u de nas zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bsdus te btus nas gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor sngon du 'gro ba'i dbang bskur ba'i le'u de nas zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bsdus te btus nas gsal bar bya'o //
translated: The chapter on the consecration of the mandala is summarized and clarified with the words then and so on.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: rgyud ni rgyud gzhan gyis rtogs bya //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyud gzhan gyis rtogs bya //
translated: The tantra is to be understood through other tantras.

original: zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the Tathāgata.

original: lha'i bdag nyid can zhes pa la gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: lha'i bdag nyid can zhes pa la gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said regarding the nature of the deity:

original: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'i bdag nyid can mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ni lha zhes mngon par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'i bdag nyid can mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ni lha zhes mngon par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The supreme unchanging bliss, whose nature is the unity of the dharmakāya, saṃbhogakāya, nirmāṇakāya, and innate joy, should be expressed as the deity.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sa bzhi gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i sa bzhi gsungs pa /
translated: The four types of ground for drawing the mandala are stated:

original: skyed mos tshal zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: The pleasure grove, and so on.

original: skyed mos tshal yid du 'ong ba dga' ba'i gnas sku dang gsungs dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid can chos 'byung gi nang du son pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje bcu drug rnam par dag pas so zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi gnas nges pa'o //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal yid du 'ong ba dga' ba'i gnas sku dang gsungs dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid can chos 'byung gi nang du son pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje bcu drug rnam par dag pas so zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi gnas nges pa'o //
translated: The mandala site is ascertained.

original: ro dang dri rnams thams cad dang ldan mtha' dag yon tan gter zhes pa //
analyzed: ro dang dri rnams thams cad dang ldan mtha' dag yon tan gter zhes pa //
translated: Endowed with all tastes and smells, a treasure of qualities,🔽the yogin should know it to have the characteristic of the realm of space.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtshan nyid can du rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o zhes pa sa'i mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtshan nyid can du rnal 'byor pas rig par bya'o zhes pa sa'i mtshan nyid nges pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the site is ascertained.

original: rdo rje'i thig dang yang ldan //
analyzed: rdo rje'i thig dang yang ldan //
translated: Endowed with vajra lines,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa la gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa la gsungs pa yang //
translated: and so on.

original: zla ba khu ba'i cha dbye bas //
analyzed: zla ba khu ba'i cha dbye bas //
translated: The moon, the part of the fluid,🔽is divided into parts

original: rdo rje'i thig ni btab pa la //
analyzed: rdo rje'i thig ni btab pa la //
translated: and applied as the vajra lines.

original: yang yang cha ru phye ba yis //
analyzed: yang yang cha ru phye ba yis //
translated: Again and again, the parts

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la'o //
